locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explains the Trinitarian blessing as a response to the Corinthian crisis and explores the depths of human sin in Psalm 130.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong historical context regarding Paul's relationship with Corinth and liturgical history of the BCP.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's love and the reality of sin, with a concluding shift toward blessing.
voorbeelden: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
This is no dry scholarly doctrine.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort through the realization of God's unmerited grace; honesty regarding sin.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; the Spirit is mentioned as part of the Trinity but not explicitly as the agent of the sermon's current effect.

voorbeelden: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
The Corinthian church has gone completely off the rails.
There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
God... pursues us even beyond the grave.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from scripture rather than issued directly by the preacher's own mandate.

voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong liturgical authority in the use of the benediction as a framing device.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 'Imagine' as a rhetorical setup.
Long historical explanation of the BCP changes.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the nature of grace but remains an observer of Paul's or the Psalmist's experience.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the specific congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' of grace is described as a historical or theological fact rather than happening 'now' in the speaking.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality but low frequency; relies on the liturgical benediction.
voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used in the 'Imagine' exercises and the final blessing.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode: talking about Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, and 'human beings'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a teaching environment rather than an encounter.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the indicative of God's nature to the declarative blessing.
voorbeelden: God is love (Assertive) -> The grace... be with you (Declarative).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is elegant but delayed by long constative sections.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: With the Lord there is mercy... therefore go forth in knowledge.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is deeply rooted in the Gospel of grace and provides immense comfort, but it functions more as a 'testimony about' grace than a 'sacramental mediation' of it until the very end.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: There used to be a way of teaching all this from the Book of Common Prayer...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Historical/liturgical lecture interrupts the kerygmatic flow.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final paragraph where the blessing is 'invoked', but much of the body is 'talking about' the event.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the Trinitarian formula as a performative frame is powerful.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, specifically in the 'invoking' of the blessing.
tekstueel_bewijs: invoking with renewed faith the apostolic blessing

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher asks God to 'grant' the effect in the final prayer.
tekstueel_bewijs: May God grant that not a single one of us...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Partially; the sermon points to the Word as the means.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong in the descriptions of light and radiance.
tekstueel_bewijs: glimmer of the full radiance of God’s love

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon relies heavily on 'is' and 'was'. It needs more 'I give' and 'He does'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The forgiveness of sins does not leave us with a cheerful, domestic idea of God.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Because God forgives you now, you are standing in the presence of a terrifyingly beautiful Majesty.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a present-tense encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often attributed to the 'psalmist' rather than spoken directly to the hearer.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: God will not let you go.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 'the parent' or 'the child' as metaphors.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the hearer's own 'depths' more directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, in your own depths, are heard by God.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good; the indicative is the focus.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'Go forth' is even more celebratory.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A beautifully written, theologically rich sermon that successfully avoids moralism, though it occasionally retreats into a lecture on liturgical history.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' as a parent; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Trinitarian blessing.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Imagine' metaphor; SAT asks if the 'Imagine' section actually performs the grace it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the 'Commissives' (God's binding promises) which are present but could be more frequent.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it performs the grace it speaks of.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for teaching, but stays in the realm of 'talking about'.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of high-quality Anglican preaching where the liturgy provides the performative 'event' while the sermon provides the constative 'depth'.
